comments:
sitrake.com's JProbe is compatible with Eclipse 1.0 but when I tried installing 
the JProbe Plug-in into Eclipse 2.0, it failed to create the JPPreference Page 
with following error when I tried Windows >> Preferences >> "JProbe Directory"

Unable to crate selected preference page.
Reason:
Plugin "com.sitraka.jprobe.eclipse" was unable to instantiate class
"com.sitraka.jprobe.eclipse.JPPreferencePage".

I just attached the zip file that I used with Eclipse. This plug-in (as

Looks like JPPreferencePage is trying to create a new Display.
This is definitely a bad thing to try to do.
There is only one Display, and it is created by the Workbench.
Not sure why the behaviour would be different between 1.0 and 2.0, but this 
looks like a defect in their code regardless.

Looks like the JProbe plugin does something bad which SWT didn't check for in 
1.0 but does check for in 2.0.
Reporter should contact Sitraka about a fix/new version of the plugin.
Moving to SWT for comment.

You can not create more than one Display on the same thread. While this may be 
allowed on Windows, it is not allowed on all platforms.  To maintain cross 
platform portability, we do not allow this state.

In 1.0, the check for this condition was written incorrectly and allowed 
multiple Displays on the same thread.  This was corrected in 2.0.

Closing this bug report as WONTFIX because the error message is intentional.

Please follow this up with sitraka to get a version of their plugin which is 
compatible with Eclipse 2.0.
